text: buried underneath this mountain in
Pakistan are hundreds of thousands of
copies of old gurans
Muslims in Pakistan believe you can't
throw away old or damaged copies of the
holy book so they're brought here from
around the country
the tunnels here stretch for over two
miles and they're all lined with these
sacks each containing around eight to
ten grands most like this one are
completely filled in you can't walk
along it Abdul Rashid Larry has been
helping run the project for the last 25
years after his brother set it up
Kuala Park and she works it was soon my
older brother loved Quran what he used
to collect them from gutters and put
them into his car some of his friends
joined him and then with God's grace all
this was established become kathira each
day more copies of old quran's are sent
here work is separate out what can be
preserved and what needs to be disposed
of now cannot furnish rundown or CD some
books like this one are only a bit
damaged so we repair them and give them
away
but when pages are torn like these we
bury them in the tunnels to keep up with
the demands they're constantly building
new tunnels but cutting into the
mountain is hard work it was so
particularly keen to dig a tunnel of 200
feet it takes four or five months some
days we only take around six inches
because the rocks are very hard in
Pakistan disposing of the Koran is a
sensitive subject
people have been lynched for not
treating it respectfully the project
here is calling for anyone in the
country with a damaged copy of the Koran
to send it to them secondo Kimani BBC
news Quetta
